For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless this function is overridden; NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}."},"decreaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`."},"extendBoost(uint256)":{"params":{"newExpiry":"New expiration of the boost"}},"getClaimable(address)":{"params":{"user":"$gBERA staker"}},"increaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"liquidate(address,uint256)":{"params":{"user":"Owner of loan to be liquidated","userLoanId":"Loan to be liquidated"}},"lock(uint256)":{"params":{"lockAmount":"Amount of $BERA to lock"}},"lookupBoost(address)":{"params":{"user":"Owner of boost"}},"lookupLoan(address,uint256)":{"params":{"user":"Originator of loan","userLoanId":"Id of loan"}},"lookupLoans(address)":{"params":{"user":"Originator of loan"}},"name()":{"details":"Returns the name of the token."},"repay(uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"repayAmount":"Amount of $BERA to repay","userLoanId":"ID of loan to repay"}},"setProtocolInterestRate(uint256)":{"params":{"_protocolInterestRate":"New interest rate"}},"setValue(uint256,address[],uint256[])":{"params":{"_nftFairValues":"The percentage each NFT is valued as a porportion of the total valuation","_nfts":"NFTs that are able to be borrowed against","_totalValuation":"The total valuation of all NFTs able to be borrowed against"}},"stake(uint256)":{"params":{"stakeAmount":"Amount of $gBERA to stake"}},"symbol()":{"details":"Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name."},"totalSupply()":{"details":"See {IERC20-totalSupply}."},"transfer(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`."},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `amount`."},"unstake(uint256)":{"params":{"unstakeAmount":"Amount of $gBERA to 72d583f49815e3f2b54","dweb:/ipfs/QmWNHay1JvxNBnz1gvXXz5GjYK8gUhMAgNsAzHmveXb1dC"]},"src/mock/IConsensusVault.sol":{"keccak256":"0x29203f263884dfc5a52ade02f2e6308d548233f127bd85a7d638d5a8e46bfd03","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://77d8301620cfd0be9dfa3d2066443680cadc052f118dcfc62f48bfb1fdb2ebf7","dweb:/ipfs/QmQnXc8ecYx7kUMC2FeUZnGjCjio6DBABbkGfizX9xo46p"]}},"version":1}

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

params.partnerNFT: NFT addresse to transfer to this contract
params.partnerNFTId: Token ID of NFT to be transferred

params.partnerNFTIds: Array of token IDs for NFTs to be transferred
params.partnerNFTs: Array of NFT addresses to transfer to this contract

params.collateralNFT: NFT collection to use as collateral
params.collateralNFTId: Token Id of NFT to use as collateral

params.collateralNFTIds: Token IDs of NFTs to use as collateral
params.collateralNFTs: NFT collections to use as collateral

params._startingPoolSize: Starting size of the lending pool

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless this function is overridden; NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

params.user: Owner of loan to be liquidated

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

params._nftFairValues: The percentage each NFT is valued as a porportion of the total valuation
params._nfts: NFTs that are able to be borrowed against
params._totalValuation: The total valuation of all NFTs able to be borrowed against

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

boost(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Locks partner NFT to receive boost on staking yield and discounted borrowing rates

boost(address[],uint256[],uint256).notice: Locks partner NFTs to receive boost on staking yield and discounted borrowing rates

emergencyWithdraw().notice: Allows the DAO to withdraw $BERA in case of emergency

extendBoost(uint256).notice: Extends the duration of an existing boost

getFairValues(address[]).notice: View the fair value of NFTs

liquidate(address,uint256).notice: Liquidates overdue loans by paying $BERA to purchase collateral

lookupBoost(address).notice: View the details of a boost

lookupLoan(address,uint256).notice: View the details of a loan

lookupLoans(address).notice: View the details of all loans originated from user

setProtocolInterestRate(uint256).notice: Allows the DAO to adjust the interest rate for the protocol

setValue(uint256,address[],uint256[]).notice: Allows the DAO to adjust the valuation of the NFTs to borrow against
